content.description: Low angle slab problem with combined foot work and upper body slab technique.
content.location: Continue climber's right from Kill Taker proper. This climb is technically on the Dab Machine boulder's tail.

content.description: "Start using opposing ramps and finish as Kill Taker." - SCC Topo 2020.
content.location: Look for two crescent/long edges on downhill side of Kill Taker boulder.

content.description: "Climb up slab to good top out." - SCC Topo 2020.This isn't much of a slab. Start on the crimpy left end of the left long crescent ramp and traverse right until you reach the start of Kill Taker Stand with your right hand on the large right side pull, and then the larger right side pull after that. Use body tension to top out straight up. If you go right it's "Balance Theory V6"
content.location: Look for two crescent-shaped/long edges on downhill side of Kill Taker boulder.

content.description: "Gain bulging face by using left pocket feature. Mantle over using small crimps." SCC Topo 2020.
content.location: Left side of Kill Take boulder

content.description: "Using the same starting holds for Kill Taker Stand, trend right to perfect edge feature. Subtle moves lead to slopers and easy slab top out." - SCC Topo 2020.Â Finishes up and right on diagonal feature of boulder. It's probably contrived because the foothold to use while turning the right corner is ambiguously close to standing on the ground such that something is probably off for the grade.
content.location: Look for two crescent/long edges on downhill side of Kill Taker boulder.

content.description: A big face on a small boulder with striking crescent features.
